author: jstrachan
msg: Refactored the code so that the behaviour is more consistent when used in deeply nested scripts.
Also added a demo/JellyUnit tests cas showing how to use CollectionTag interface for processing beans generically

author: jstrachan
msg: redundant API, can use CollecitonTag instead

author: jstrachan
msg: added a new simple interface to allow the processing of beans using a Composite pattern

author: jstrachan
msg: added cvs ignore to hide build stuff

author: werken
msg: Adding the throws JellyTagException to the setAttribute(...) so that
sub-classes can throw it, even though StaticTag itself does not.
Is there a mode for checkstyle to ensure that subclasses throw
the same exceptions as their super-classes/super-interfaces so
that unwritten-yet subclasses can still throw them as an option?
